item.description:
This special meetup will be geared towards newcomers to Django. Kevin Grinberg has offered to give an hour-long Getting Started with Django presentation.

The presentation will be followed by a panel of experts to answer questions that you may have. Example questions might be: What do I need to get going? What are the basics (views, layouts,...)? How do I try, test, and debug? What are the beginner pitfalls?

Below is Kevin's rough outline for what he'd like to cover - it's relatively comprehensive, and since we're shooting for about an hour, some of the pieces will be pretty cursory.

His goal is to give people enough of a grounding that when they go look at a piece of code or look something up in the docs, it won't sound *too* foreign ("oh yeah, I've heard of Context Processors, I kinda get it").  

One potentially useful thing to do if enough experienced Djangonauts are interested - people can stick around after and help newbies set up their environments... That's the part that tends to trip a lot of people up.  

 

  • Python
  • The Environment
    • Virtualenv
  • MTV
  • Life cycle of a Django request
  • Models (+QuerySets)
  • Views
  • Templates (+tags/filters)
  • Forms/ModelForms
  • The Admin
  • Debugging:
    • manage.py (+shell_plus)
    • Debug toolbar
  • Deployment
  • Other goodies...
    • South for database schema migrations
    • CSRF
    • Contrib/pluggable apps
    • settings.py
    • Context Processors
    • Middleware
    • Testing framework
    • Transactions
    • Formsets
    • Generic Views

 

If you have ideas of things that you'd like to have covered, please comment in the discussion forums and/or mailing lists.
item.name: Getting Started with Django
